Wasilik Poplar Trail

Mile 103 | June 10, 2007

Wasilik Poplar

Mile 103 | June 10, 2007

This (dead) tree is the second-largest poplar in the United States, with a diameter of 8.6 feet and standing 125.5 feet tall. It escaped logging in the early 1900s because it was deemed too big to be hauled by oxen.

Mile 677 | July 19, 2007

Audie Murphy Monument

Mile 677 | July 19, 2007

Audie Murphy was the most decorated American solider of the second world war, made legend by his single-handed capture of a large number of German soldiers. After the war, he acted in a number of Hollywood films and died in a 1971 plane crash near this monument.
